src.gui.editor
Class EditorControlFrame

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Frame
                  javax.swing.JFrame
                      src.gui.editor.EditorControlFrame
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class EditorControlFrame
extends javax.swing.JFrame

This frame keeps track of what action will take place when the user clicks on the Editor Window. It also has the menu options dealing with the level and switching between levels.

Author:
Darren Watts date 1/28/09
See Also:
Serialized Form

jbInit

private void jbInit()
             throws java.lang.Exception
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

readyForInput

public void readyForInput(java.awt.Component comp)
Tells the component to listen for keystrokes for movement.

Parameters:
comp - The component you want to add the listener to.

setUpInitialSelection

private void setUpInitialSelection()
Fills in the combo boxes with lists, and picks the first option in the main type combo box. It will then update the rest of the display to match the current selection. This is called when the window is first created.

fillLevelSelectBox

public void fillLevelSelectBox()
Fills the level select box with the city names.

updateWindowBasedOnMainSelection

private void updateWindowBasedOnMainSelection()
Checks to see what type is selected in the main type selector and makes components visible/invisible based on that choice. It will also fill in the combo boxes with the correct set of lists for that selection.

updateWindowBasedOnLandSubtype

private void updateWindowBasedOnLandSubtype()
Updates the labels based on thel and subtype selection. It only does something if Land type exit is chosen. Based on the subtype, it will update the label for destination row of the exit to be more clear as to what it does.

updateWindowBasedOnLandSelection

private void updateWindowBasedOnLandSelection()
Checks to see what type is selected in the land type submenu and sets components based on that choice.

errorMessage

private void errorMessage(java.lang.String str)
Creates a pop up error message with the given text.

Parameters:
str - String : error message

checkBounds

private EditorControlFrame.Bounds checkBounds(int row,
                                              int col)
Checks to see whether the specified row and column is on the border of the current city or outside of the city. It will return a Border enum specifying whether it is in the city, on the border of the city, or outside the city.

Parameters:
row - int : row
col - int : col
Returns:
Bounds : Bounds enum type

leftClick

public void leftClick(int row,
                      int col)
The user has left clicked on the main editor window. This method will create the currently selected land object at this location.

Parameters:
row - int : row to place land
col - int : column to place land

middleClick

public void middleClick(int row,
                        int col)
The user has middle clicked on the main editor window. This method will change what is selected based on what object was clicked on. This will allow you to view the information on something that is already placed on the map.

Parameters:
row - int : row of object
col - int : column of object

setRowColDisplay

private void setRowColDisplay(int row,
                              int col)
Sets the row and column fields in the display to the specified row and column. It will set the "Destination Row" and "Destination Column" text fields to show the information. This is used when middle clicking on the land, to see which row and column that land object is in.

Parameters:
row - int : row
col - int : col

rightClick

public void rightClick(int row,
                       int col)
The user has right clicked on the main editor window. This method will create the currently selected object at this location.

Parameters:
row - int : row to place object
col - int : column to place object

addLevel

private void addLevel()
Brings up the add level frame.

deleteLevel

private void deleteLevel()
Brings up a dialog asking if the level should be deleted. If yes, delete the current level.

finishAddLevel

public void finishAddLevel()
Happens at the end of adding a level. This updates the GUI so the new level shows up properly.

updateForSizeChange

public void updateForSizeChange()
Updates the window when the size of the city changes.

loadPrefFile

private void loadPrefFile()
Loads the information from the prefs file and sets the window size based on it.

writePrefFile

private void writePrefFile()
Writes the window locations and sizes to a preferences file.

checkForStartLocations

private boolean checkForStartLocations()
Checks to see if every city has a player start location. If one does not, it will give an error message to the user, and return false. Otherwise, it will return true.

Returns:
boolean : start locations on every city

save

private void save()
If a save path has already been set up, just save to that file. Otherwise, call the saveAs method.

saveAs

private void saveAs()
Brings up a save dialog and saves the map file.

load

private void load()
Brings up a file dialog and loads from the chosen file.

mnuEditInsertLevels_actionPerformed

public void mnuEditInsertLevels_actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
Edit insert levels menu. It creates temporary instances of the gameworld and adds the levels from a specified file to the currently loaded gameworld.

Parameters:
e - ActionEvent
